DOC.brief_summary: This randomize pilot clinical trial study exercise intervention improving quality life exercise capacity reduce inflammation oxidative stress patient lung cancer support person . Exercise therapy may help improve quality life , may increase exercise capacity , may reduce inflammation oxidative stress patient lung cancer supporter .
DOC.brief_title: Impacts Exercise Prognostic Biomarkers Lung Cancer Patients
DOC.detailed_description: PRIMARY OBJECTIVES : I . Determine effect eight-week exercise intervention biomarkers inflammation , oxidative stress , exercise capacity , quality life lung cancer patient . SECONDARY OBJECTIVES : I . Determine effect eight-week exercise intervention marker stress quality life support person lung cancer patient . OUTLINE : Participants randomize 1 2 arm . ARM A : Patients support person undergo supervise combined aerobic exercise comprise walking , cycling , video-based aerobics strength training use resistance band 40 minute 2 day week University Wisconsin Hospital Clinic ( UWHC ) 3 day week home 8 week . ARM B : Patients support person undergo usual care 8 week .
DOC.criteria: LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : A confirmed diagnosis stage lung cancer ( nonsmall cell lung cancer [ NSCLC ] small cell lung cancer [ SCLC ] ) LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Can receive type treatment ( chemotherapy , radiation therapy , neither ) eligible LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Able understand read English sufficiently adequately complete inform consent participate complete questionnaire LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : For patient treated curative intent , relapse , must within 1 year diagnosis lung cancer ( determine date diagnostic pathology sample ) SUPPORT PERSONS : Able understand read English sufficiently adequately complete inform consent participate complete questionnaire LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Symptomatic heart disease include congestive heart failure arrhythmia LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Documented myocardial infarction last three month LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Central nervous system ( CNS ) metastases result impaired ability participate exercise program discretion study physician LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Any psychological physical disease would impair prevent participation exercise program discretion study physician LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Cognitive reading impairment would preclude complete questionnaire LUNG CANCER PATIENTS : Current participation exercise program SUPPORT PERSONS : Symptomatic heart disease include congestive heart failure arrhythmia SUPPORT PERSONS : Documented myocardial infarction last three month SUPPORT PERSONS : Cognitive reading impairment would preclude complete questionnaire
